title: Coronation Street's Andrew Whyment is 'confirmed' for I'm A Celebrity
text:
Coronation Street star Andrew Whyment has reportedly signed up to join Ant and Dec in the jungle for I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here.

The 38-year-old actor, best known for playing Kirk Sutherland on the ITV soap, is the eighth rumoured contestant said to be travelling to Australia in three weeks' time.

According to The Sun, producers are 'really pleased' with the line-up this year and were 'chuffed' when Andrew allegedly agreed to take part.

Heading Down Under? Coronation Street favourite Andrew Whyment, 38, is the eighth rumoured contestant thought to be travelling to Australia for I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here in three weeks' time

'They were chuffed to get Andrew as viewers have watched him on Coronation Street for the best part of two decades, yet know nothing about him away from Kirk,' a source said.

A spokesperson for I'm a A Celeb told MailOnline: 'It's just speculation. We'll announce our line up for the new series nearer transmission.'

Andrew has played Corrie favourite Kirk since 2000 and had a part in The Royle Family before joining the soap.

He took part in Dancing On Ice in 2012, before being eliminated in the eighth week.

Andrew looks set to become the 11th Corrie actor to enter the jungle.

Soap stalwart: Andrew has played Corrie favourite Kirk Sutherland since 2000, and had a part in The Royle Family before joining the soap

Jennie McAlpine, who plays Andrew's on-screen ex Fizz Brown, came fourth in 2017's edition of I'm a Celeb.

Other notable Coronation Street stars who have taken part in the show include Antony Cotton (Sean Tully), Nigel Havers (Lewis Archer), Helen Flanagan (Rosie Webster), Craig Charles (Lloyd Mullaney) and, last year, Sair Khan (Alya Nazir).

This year's line-up looks set to be a good one; rumoured campmates include Girls Aloud singer Nadine Coyle, EastEnders actress Jacqueline Jossa, rugby star James Haskell, footballer Ian Wright and Good Morning Britain presenter Kate Garraway.

Radio presenter Ronan Kemp, who is the son of Spandau Ballet's Martin Kemp, is also reportedly set to appear in the jungle alongside Myles Stephenson from X Factor winners Rak-Su.

Following in her footsteps? Jennie McAlpine, who plays Andrew's onscreen ex Fizz Brown, came fourth in 2017's I'm a Celeb

Meanwhile, GMB host Kate recently revealed her children Darcey, 13, and William, 10, have urged her to take part in the show, but she finds it 'completely terrifying'.

She said previously: 'I think it's completely terrifying but it's also a brilliant show to watch, so I don't know.

'My kids would love me to do it, I don't know what that says. People keep saying I'd be good in there and basically what that means is you want to see me tortured.

'Like really close friends say, "Oh you'd be amazing, I really want you to do it." And it's like, "What have I done to you?" Does anybody want to go through that torture, I don't know?'
description: Coronation Street star Andrew Whyment has reportedly signed up to join Ant and Dec in the jungle  for I'm A Celebrity ... Get Me Out Of Here.
